title: Change Background Color to Blue
description: Update the application background color to blue
content:
## Task: Change Background Color to Blue

### Context
The fountain-pens app is a React TypeScript application using Material UI (MUI). The user wants to change the application's background color to blue.

### Requirements
- Change the main application background color to blue
- Ensure the blue color works well with the existing UI elements and text readability
- Use an appropriate shade of blue that doesn't clash with the MUI components

### Implementation Approach
1. Check if there's an existing MUI theme configuration (look for `createTheme` calls)
2. If a theme exists, update `palette.background.default` to a blue color
3. If no theme exists, either:
   - Create a theme with the blue background, or
   - Add the background color via global CSS in `src/index.css` or the root App component
4. Consider using a light blue shade (e.g., `#e3f2fd` or MUI's `blue[50]`) to maintain readability
5. Test that text and other UI elements remain visible and accessible

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Application background is blue
- [ ] Text remains readable against the blue background
- [ ] All existing UI components still look good
- [ ] No accessibility issues with color contrast
